result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph E Schook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

Must seek and maintain full-time employment commensurate with treatment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with victim in 16CM86 to allow contact for family issues.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and your probation agent.  Must comply with any recommendations of your probation agent for programming or treatment.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 
Defendant must submit to random PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.
Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.
If agent deems appropriate must participate in Domestic Violence Court.  
Must submit a DNA sample to Jackson County Jail and pay the surcharge.
Credity for 34 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

JOC and Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures, etc returned undelivered - "Moved Left No Address Unable to Forward Return to Sender"

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Tainter.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No corrections or changes made by the parties.  State recommended:  5 months jail.  Credit for 114 days.  Defense agrees with the credit for 114 days.  Defense recommending 5 months jail.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 

Court ordered: 5 months jail.  Credit for 114 days.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 9, 2019 at 11:30 am.
from DOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel SPD Travis Satorius.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  16CM56 - victim notification has been complied with.   Defendant will plead to the following: 16CM86 - Count 1,   16CM143 - Count 1,  16CM206 - Counts 2, 3, 5.  All others will be DRI.  16CM56 involves a victim he has a child with which makes it a domestic violence offense and he is pleading to it as charged.  16CM86 - Count 1 plea of no contest.  16CM143 - Count 1 plea of no contest.  16CM206 - Counts 2,3,5 all pleas of no contest.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding his pleas/elements/waiver of rights.  Deportation warning given.  Defense stipulates to the factual basis in the complaints.  Court finds he understands the proceedings, enters his pleas/waives his rights FVKI, a factual basis exists and is found guilty to the counts plead to as stated.  All remaining counts are to be dismissed and read-in.

Joint recommendation to withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of:  No alcohol nor to be where sold/served.  Must undergo an AODA assessment, comply with all recommendations of probation agent and sign releases.  Must obtain employment commensurate with treatment needs.  Must undergo a risk and needs assessment and comply with any recommendations.  No violent, aggressive, disorderly contact with victim in 16CM56.  Defense makes his statement to the Court.  He has 34 days jail credit for all cases.  ADA stipulates to that credit.

Court adopts the joint recommendation and withholds sentence and places him on 3 years probation on all counts pled to with conditions as requested plus........ Subject to random testing by agent.  No alcohol.  No violent, abusive, threatening, or disorderly contact with victim to allow contact for child issues.  If agent deems appropriate must participate in DV Court.  Must submit a DNA sample.  To report to probation today.  $500 cash bond on file is to be applied.  Granted 34 days sentence credit.
of 8/7/17 plea/sentencing hearing notice.    Moved left no address.  Unable to Forward.    Return to Sender
cancel per SO yellow sheet; JASO canceled already in custody since 9/7/17

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph E Schook
Current: 213 South 6th St., Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 09-07-2017)
Prior: 331 North Water St., #2, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States

Covers 16CF206, 16CM86 and 16CM143.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: S.J.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail. No counsel present.  He thought his court date was the 8th.  Court advised him of his attorney rights.  STC set for 9/11 at 3 pm.
